Core Message: Climate change is a problem of consumption and consumption is caused by operating from an emotional center, rather than a spiritual center.
Excerpt: Whenever you become emotional, you start releasing carbon and cause climate change. When one is emotional, he may drink, or party, or go on a foreign trip, or create a nest of his own with two kids - all of this is carbon emissions in a big way. This is because if you don't provide liberation to a man, his energy flows in the direction of consumption. And consumption is carbon emissions and climate change. The solution to this is nothing but true spirituality.

Link: Your hero is a scoundrel || Acharya Prashant, at IIT-Bombay (2022)
Title: Your Role Models Are Destroying The Planet
Core Message: Our role models reflect our ideal of consumption and the result is catastrophic climate change.
Excerpt: Your role models are unworthy people. They're your role models only because you aspire to consume as much as them. Notice how they either display their ability to consume or they present themselves as stuff to be consumed. So, when consumption is the ideal that we have been taught, the result is catastrophic climate change. So, don’t just be driven to anything that appears attractive; choose your role models very carefully - it's got something to do with Love.

Link: Acharya Prashant meets his teacher Dr. Trilochan Sastry: Religion, Democracy & Constitution
Title: Why was Ambedkar against Hinduism?
Core Message: Ambedkar was against popular Hindu culture based on Smruti texts. Ambedkar was never against Vedanta
Excerpt: Dr. Ambedkar, one of the greatest  minds of modern India, had problems with Hindu culture, but not with Vedanta. Our culture is based on the very periphery of religion and does not resonate with Vedanta. That's the reason it is in conflict with the Constitution.  Constitution and true religiosity, which you can call as self-knowledge or Vedanta, they go together.

Link: Can Vedanta Address the Problem of Economic Recession?
Title: Yet Another Stock Market Crash?
Core Message: Economics does not address the fundamental human problems of ignorance and greed.
Excerpt: Economic bubbles have nothing but human ignorance and greed at their core. If we could only invest where there is real value, there wouldn't be any bubbles at all. However, intelligence becomes lame when emotions rule; greed will totally obfuscate your intelligence. And economics does not address the problem of ignorance and greed. It's the Upanishads and Gita that address this problem.

Title: Will AI take away my job?
Core Message: AI and threat to employment
Excerpt: AI has no consciousness; it can only do what it is programmed to do. They are just programmed reactions. If you are in a job that involves this kind of programmable, role your job would be threatened by AI. Human beings, by definition, must be in actions that involve creativity. Machines can never understand. Why were you not into jobs that involved understanding or creativity?

Link: Why do we want to ‘see’ first and then believe? || Acharya Prashant, on Jesus Christ
Title: Doubting Thomas: Did Christ Resurrect?
Core Message: Faith has to be absolutely reasonless. Faith of Thomas is founded on reasons. It is not a perfect faith.
Excerpt: Only the man who believes in the world that he sees with his eyes would want the proof of Godliness admissible through the eyes. Such doubting Thomases do not see that what the eyes see is not really true. Only a Christ can tell you what is True and what is false. And if you are suspecting Christ himself, there is nobody who can now tell you the difference.

Link: Why am I unable to be involved in my work?
Title:
Boring Weekdays, Happening Weekends
OR
Weekday Blues, Weekend Highs
Core Message: Work is Play and Play is work.
Excerpt: Can a man who is bored during the weekdays suddenly become lively over the weekend? Why is there a separation? There is work and then there is something else. It means you do not know what you are doing. When you have no real relationship with your work, you do not have any relationship with yourself, and all your life you are just seeking holidays.

Link: Why is Jesus asking to hate one's life?
Title: When Jesus Said: Hate Your Family And Your Life
Core Message: When we love we chain each other. When God loves us he sets us free. Love each other like the Father loves us.
Excerpt: Jesus  is not a hater of persons. He is saying hate the way you have become. The Bible  is not a document of hate, the central message is of Love. But when we love, we chain each other. When God loves us, He sets us free. So Jesus is saying to hate the way we relate to each other — because our love is not Godly. Love each other just as God the Father has loved you.

Title: Should You Trust You Feelings?
Core Message: Feelings come from conditioning and the wise are not slaves of any type of conditioning.
Excerpt: When feelings surge in your mind and body, be careful and pay attention! This is the moment when you lose the plot! The initial surge of energy that a feeling has is beyond your consciousness and control; it is determined mostly by your conditioning and partly by your genes. So, don't add conscious energy to the unconscious uprising. The most important mark of a wise man is that he does not live by feelings. You can give feelings any name; they remain the same.

Link: When will life be sorted for good? || BITS Pilani (2022)
Title: When will life be sorted for good?
Core Message: Life will never be fully sorted so learn to love the battle.
Excerpt: There has never, ever been anybody 100% sorted. There are always challenges, and those challenges arise from the body itself; your enemy is within you, and it will remain as long as you are alive. So, learn to revel in this situation — it's called life. And instead of asking for a final victory, start asking for a good battle — battles where, even in your pain, you can say, “This one was good!”

Title:
Leap Before You're Sure
OR
Clarity Begins Where Overthinking Ends
Core Message: We have to take action even if we are not 100% sure. Aboslute certainty is a myth.
Excerpt: You will never be 100% certain. There would always be an iota of doubt, but you have to proceed to do what you believe to be right. Those who have made great, heartful attempts, even in unwise directions, have been relatively quicker in coming to the Truth because they tested out their hypothesis. If you wait for absolute clarity, you are just denying your own potential.

Title:
Makeup And Masks

OR

Hiding Behind Cosmetics?

OR

The Rise Of A Cosmetic Society
Core Message: Cosmetics are a way to mask the inner void that we are all looking to fill.
Excerpt: It's one thing to take care of the body so that it doesn't interfere with your creative endeavours. And it is another thing entirely to put on makeup to enhance your value in other people's eyes. When you don't have value within, you put artificial value upon yourself as a compensation. But looking colorful on the outside does not help with the inward barreness. And ultimately, it is the inner color, vigour, truth, and love that we are all looking for.

Link: The Fear Of One's Own Existence
Title: You Are A Servant Of Your Mind
Core Message: Don’t trust someone who is a servant of his Mind
Excerpt: The common mind is fragmented, one part of the mind is dominated by one power, another part by a totally different power. People make resolutions and then they can't live up to them, because the part that resolves to do something is no more the dominant part after a few days or hours. And that's also the reason why they are not dependable. Trust only the one who is a master of his mind, not a servant.

Title:
Parents, Apologize To Your Children!
OR
What Are A Parent's Responsibilities?
OR 
What Is A Parent's Duty?
Core Message: Parents are indebted to the child's liberation because they brought him into a world of suffering.
Excerpt: A child is born as someone to whom the parents are deeply indebted because they have committed the mistake of bringing another person into a world of agony, longing, and suffering. There was nobody to suffer, and you unnecessarily brought suffering into the world. Now the least you can do is to give the child the conditions that would enable his or her liberation from suffering.

Link: The total is neither masculine or feminine hence the search and summit of both
Title: Why Do We Give Duality Names?
Core Message: We like giving names to duality to strengthen our tendencies and preferences
Excerpt: What ‘is’, is non-dual, what is dualistic, is not. The two ends of that duality can be given any name (like masculine and feminine, black and white), but there is only one duality, called “duality”. We give duality names according to our own inclinations and preferences which further strengthen them. Just know that this is dualistic, don’t give it names.

Link: The total is neither masculine or feminine hence the search and summit of both
Title: What Is Permanency, Eternity And Timelessness?
Core Message: Spirituality gives you something which is beyond the dimension of time
Excerpt: “Permanency” is just a very long stretch in time, what begins is bound to come to an end. “Eternity” is still in the domain of time. It is an indication towards time that never ends, so it is just a metaphor. “Timelessness” is beyondness. When the “now” is used to indicate timelessness then we call it the Present. Spirituality gives you something which is beyond the dimension of time.

Link: How does knowledge cleanse the mind?
Title:
Is News Of Any Use?
OR
News You Can't Use
Core Message: Knowing the world is useful only if it leads to knowing oneself. Else Knowledge is just bondage.
Excerpt: Both the TV channel and the newspapers use news as a vehicle to bring advertisements to you. You are being subtly manipulated  to buy and consume, consume and buy.  Knowledge can be both—bondage and liberation. Knowing the world is knowing oneself, knowing oneself is knowing the world. It pays to know the world. And that is different from being obsessed with the world.

Link: All attitudes are dangerous, whether 'positive' or 'negative'
Title:
Positive Thinking And Negative Thinking: Two Sides Of The Same Coin
OR
The Myth Of Positive And Negative Thinking
Core Message: Approach situations with a fresh mind, without a positive or negative notions.
Excerpt: There is nothing called ‘positive attitude’ or ‘negative attitude’. All attitudes are enemy of understanding and reality. An intelligent man lives a life free of attitude. Within attitude, you approach reality with a fixed, frozen mindset. When you come to a situation, come to it afresh. Neither with a ‘positive’ nor a ‘negative’, attitude. Just real intelligence.

Link: Religious Fanatics and Bigots - Where Do They Come from?
Title: Why Do We Still Have Religious Violence & Terrorism?
Core Message: All violence comes from ignorance i.e. the lack of understanding of the self.
Excerpt: Religious violence is not about a handful of terrorists; it's an entire ecosystem of passive toxicity supported by lakhs of people. When toxicity is beamed to you on TV and social media, you don't resist. And so, society is indoctrinated to be violent within. And one day it explodes into active violence. This is because we're still animals who live without understanding ourselves - this is called ignorance. Therefore, we need wisdom literature to help us transcend our animal disposition.

Title: Does Religion Perpetuate Terrorism?
Core Message: Organized religion, Terrorism, True Religion, Swadharma
Excerpt: What you call as ‘International Terrorism’ today is very much a religion-driven phenomenon. What you see in religious gatherings and fairs is organized religion, which has often led to conflicts. Religion can be wonderful if it is the quest of the individual mind to return to its source — that which Shri Krishna refers to as 'Swadharma'.

Title: The Inner War That Becomes Outer War
Core Message: War
Excerpt: When you are internally at war, you will very easily find a lot of enemies outside. Those who find that they do not like the world, or that people in the world are out to hurt them, must know that the world is appearing hostile because they are internally at war. Basic inner fragmentation - twenty thousand slaves, each a slave to another slave, quarreling with each other. That is war.

Link: You are so powerful that it scares you
Title: You Are So Powerful That It Scares You
Core Message: Drawn to Fire, Afraid to Burn
Excerpt: You really want to fly free and that is why you are so afraid of flying. If something is dangerous but it doesn’t attract you, is it really dangerous? You will never step into it, so there is no danger. Something is dangerous only when it is not only dangerous but also attractive. It is your own attraction towards largeness, towards greatness that you are scared of.

Title: Why Does Your Mood Change In An Instant?
Core Message: Life is a constant flux and so is the human body
Excerpt: You cannot detect subtle changes in your body, but you can detect the almost instantaneous changes in your mind and mood. This moment, you were thinking of somebody as your beloved. And then somebody tells you that this person is not that one. In a fraction of a second, your universe changes. You are not a static thing, you are in constant flux just like everything else around you.

Link: Do We Really Have A Choice Or Is It All An Illusion
Title: What Is The Real Choice We Have?
Core Message: The only real choice is to observe our choices
Excerpt: Acknowledging that you are not somebody who has to go by your chemical nature is the first step and that's very close to the last step. The moment you see that you are not helpless in this regard, the power to choose awakens.  That which appears instinctively right, has to be observed. And when you observe it, the observation itself is the choice that leads to detachment.

Link: Knowing That Brain is Chemical Why Do I Still Suffer
Title: Knowing That The Brain is Chemical, Why Do I Still Suffer?
Core Message: Suffering is not because of the chemical reactions in the body
Excerpt: Tendencies proceed as per pre-set patterns of chemical reactions. And when tendencies do that, tendencies are alright. The tendencies do not suffer, you do. You are not your tendencies. Had you been your tendencies, why would there have been any suffering? You are not alright when you act per your tendencies. Your restlessness is because of your association with the chemical reaction.

Link: What Does It Mean To Be Superconscious?
Title: What Does It Mean To Be Superconscious?
Core Message: Superconsciousness is not in another dimension
Excerpt: Superconsciousness is not in another dimension; it belongs to this world that we are in. It is a word to emphasize that it is possible to rise above ordinary consciousness. Ordinary consciousness is a state of mental slavery. The more liberated one is internally, the higher is said to be the state of consciousness. And beyond a certain point, you may say that a fellow is superconscious.

Link: What is desireless action? || Acharya Prashant (2019)
Title: Your Goals Are Trapping You
Core Message: Working towards 'an end' in mind leads to a vicious cycle. On the other hand, when work is done for the sake of the work itself, you celebrate all the way to success.
Excerpt: Those who work towards 'an end' find that they are defeated both in the work and in achieving 'the end' because even if they somehow manage to reach that end, they find that it's not really what they wanted. So, they proceed to the next destination; this is a vicious cycle. On the other hand, those who work because the work itself is a celebration, they win doubly because the work itself is the end, and they celebrate all the way to success.

Link: What is Dharma in Today’s World? How to Fight Adharma?
Title: Does The Bhagavad Gita Support War?
Core Message: The Mahabharata was fought to ensure that Dharma prevails over Adharma - not for revenge.
Excerpt: We often feel that the Mahabharata war was about avenging the atrocities that Duryodhana had been committing. But in fact, the war was to stop Duryodhana from wreaking havoc on the entire country in the future. If the state policies themselves promote Adharma, then the effect on the population would certainly be derogatory. Therefore, despite the likely great loss of lives, it was still important to fight the war.

Title: Stay Away From 'Spirituality'
Core Message: Anything that does not have to do with the suffering of the "I", or ego, is not true spirituality.
Excerpt: The suffering of the 'I' (ego) is at the root of all spiritual pursuit. Therefore, when dealing with words like religion, spirituality, always ask: "Where is the 'I' in it? Is it taking me within myself or further into tradition and imagination?" 'Spirituality' talks of various things like spirits, ghosts, etc. that can neither be verified nor negated. Whereas 'Adhyatma' or self-knowledge, which is a much better word, is the very art of ruthless negation of all imaginary products of the ego.

Title: Stay Away From ' Pop Spirituality'
Core Message: Pop spirituality vs Self knowledge.
Excerpt: ‘Pop spirituality’ can include anything—some kriya, snakes, spirits, ghosts —things that can neither be verified nor negated. India had a better name: ‘Adhyatma’, which means ‘self-knowledge’, not ‘spirituality’. And once you realize it's about knowing yourself through self-inquiry, it becomes the ruthless negation of all imaginary products of the ego — with deep respect for facts.

Title: True Relationships Arise from Aloneness
Core Message: In aloneness, you have great relationships
Excerpt: You may say that you are in love; but do you love that man, or do you love what you get through that man? When you are needy and lonely, then your relationships are like band-aids: they are there to take care of your wounds. But if you live your life from a point of aloneness — which is totally different from loneliness — your relationships will take on a different colour. Then you will really be free and not a slave.

Link: Why Have Religions Emerged Only From A Few Places In The World
Title: If You Want Religious Inquiry, then Stop!
Core Message: Religious inquiry needs inner stillness and inner leisure
Excerpt: You cannot have religious inquiry if you are running behind your ambitions all day. If internal leisure is not there, no wisdom can develop. You have to stop for long durations and recollect: "What’s going on? Am I just running?" Where there is man, there is dissatisfaction; and where there is dissatisfaction, there is an inquiry into the reason for dissatisfaction — and that inquiry itself is called religion.

Link: Dont Blindly Rush Into Good Deeds
Title: What Is Misplaced Climate Activism?
Core Message: Find the most effective way to tackle climate change
Excerpt: Everybody is becoming a climate activist, without realizing what really needs to be done. You have to think of the most effective way to tackle the issue because the opportunity cost is great. For example, in one year a tree absorbs 0.025 tonne, whereas, having one less child causes a difference of 60 tonnes per year. Misplaced climate activism is not solving the problem, it is a part of the problem.

Link: Dont Blindly Rush Into Good Deeds
Title: Emotions = Carbon
Core Message: Emotions are causing climate change
Excerpt: Emotions are causing climate change. We are so emotional about having two nice kids, that is emotion and that is carbon. Whenever you get emotional, you start releasing carbon dioxide. When you do not operate from a spiritual center then, you operate from an emotional center. The most effective way to fight climate change is spiritual awareness.

Link: How To Bring About A Total Women's Revolution
Title: Women! Fly Away From Your Nest!
Core Message: The nest is a woman's cage
Excerpt: The nest is an expression of a woman's body or biological self. The woman thinks the nest is her protective cocoon, but it is her cage. As long as the woman keeps thinking that freedom is about flaunting her body, there is no freedom for her. Therefore, the woman will have to actively rebel against the nest by spending time gaining knowledge, enriching and skilling herself.

Link: The UPSC Craze And The Coaching Industry In India
Title: Is UPSC Craze A National Loss?
Core Message: UPSC is a national loss for India
Excerpt: 98% of the UPSC candidates should actually never have been candidates. Before one decides to invest one's life into something, shouldn’t one ask, “Am I even cut out for this?” “Do I have any worthwhile reason to pursue this?” The entire young section of the population — full of energy, is squandering its years preparing for an examination and by the time they're through with it, they're spent and old. This is a tremendous national loss.

Link: The Real Way to Deal With Dependency
Title: The Real Way To Deal With Dependency
Core Message: The only way to fight loneliness and dependency is to go to the Spiritual scriptures
Excerpt: You are born with a feeling of loneliness and dependency.  Even if you live till 126, you will find that loneliness still haunts you. The real way to fight this is to go to the scriptures. Once you develop the taste of being with Shri Krishna or a Mahavira, you will forget loneliness and dependency. And to make space for them, you have to evict all the nonsense that is sitting in your mind.

Title: Love Versus Desire
Core Message: Difference Between Love & Desire
Excerpt: Love is always dedicated to the purpose of liberation, whereas desire forgets the highest and remembers only the object. If, in the process of love, desire, or attraction, you find that you have never lost sight of the Truth, rest assured — you are loving. But if the object becomes so dominant that you have totally forgotten the Truth, know that this is not love.

Link: Why Do Even Educated People Believe in Caste?
Title: Why Does Caste Still Continue?
Core Message: Only real education can end the caste system
Excerpt: Caste is something that the Upanishads actively dismiss. So many of our Saints came from the so-called lower castes and tried to purge Hinduism of its nonsense, but still, caste continues for two reasons. First, a human is born with an innate tendency to divide and separate. And second, a light has to be awakened in him, and that effort is called real education. We do not receive that education today.

Title: Who Are The People Who Still Keep Caste Alive?
Core Message: If you are interested in somebody’s caste, you are a casteist
Excerpt: You should not even know somebody’s caste, that’s how caste disappears. If you are interested in somebody’s caste, you are a casteist! You meet someone, the person is standing in-front of you, assess him, why do you want to know his caste? Is the person not sufficient? If he is sick, you want to help him, and if he is arrogant, you want to show him his place; you don’t want to enquire into his caste.

Title: Caste Exists Only in the Mind
Core Message: If you are interested in somebody’s caste, you are a casteist
Excerpt: Caste is not in the body, it is just in the mind. If you are interested in somebody’s caste, you are a casteist! You meet someone, the person is standing in front of you — assess him as good, bad, or whatever — but why do you want to know his caste? Caste should have been relegated to the museums and the history books by now. Drop it right now! But to drop it, you will need to have self-knowledge.

Title: Why Are We in an Age of Extremism?
Core Message: Man is extreme today because he has forgotten the purpose of life
Excerpt: Man is taking extreme measures in the external world due to his extreme inner hollowness. This hollowness is coming from a philosophy of endless consumption, and from technology that is capable of producing endlessly. But the purpose of our life is the spiritual urge to be liberated. And when we don't find this purpose, we indulge in stupid things like religious extremism and extreme merrymaking.

Link: That Which Neither Changes Or Is Unchanging
Title:
It Is Not Your Desire At All!

Have You Really Seen Your Desires?

How To Really See Your Desires?
Core Message: When you have seen where your desires come from, you are very close to fulfilling your real desire
Excerpt: We operate from a center of knowledge and ascribe consciousness to it, but it is not conscious, it is very material. Once you see that, you stop giving respect to your consciousness, and you see where your desires come from. Then you are very close to fulfilling your real desire. The real desire is to get liberated, but it expresses itself in the form of attraction or aversion towards things, it’s catastrophic!

Link: How To Succeed In Getting A Good Quality Life
Title: Have It All But Are Still Unfulfilled?
Core Message: When you have attained worldly success, the path forward is to work for a cause much bigger than oneself and forget one's own personal desires.
Excerpt: For those who already have a certain level of financial, social, intellectual, and familial attainment, but are still not satisfied, the only thing that can fulfill them is forgetfulness towards their personal success. Serve a cause bigger than yourself, and there will be no time or opportunity to keep wondering whether your demands have been met. This is when you have really succeeded.

Title: Are You Helping Others With The Hope Of Liberation?
Core Message: Help others out of love, not out of a hope for liberation, yours or theirs
Excerpt: The mind has to be liberated from time, the past and the future, and future means hope. If you are helping the other with the hope of gaining personal liberation, you are not liberated from hope. And it means you still see a difference between yourself and the other, the help would only reinforce the self, not liberate it. You help because you love the other, not with the hope of liberation.

Title: The Robot's Ego
Core Message: Freedom comes from disassocation, not more association
Excerpt: The robot does have an ego planted into it by its designer, but it is in total bondage, and thus, choiceless. Ego is a sense of I, it could either be robotic or real. Robotic or slave ego is dependent on others - if the other disappears, the ”I amness” itself disappears. Real ego is self-dependent. It does not think associations will give it fulfillment, because freedom comes from dissociation.

Link: Is it violence when Krishna is asking Arjun to fight? || Acharya Prashant (2016)
Title: When Peace Looks Like War
Core Message: Peace is about the right action in the moment coming from clarity and love. It is not a duty or a prescribed action.
Excerpt: Before the Mahabharata war, Shri Krishna himself had tried his utmost to prevent war because that was the right action in that moment. But on the battlefield, he goes beyond his brief as a charioteer and rushes towards Bheeshma to attack. You don't think this is an image of peace, but it is. Peace is not about adjustment or reconciliation or diplomacy. It is about the action that takes us towards the Truth that comes from clarity and love.

Link: To know why a man and a woman are in conflict is to know why world is in conflict || Acharya Prashant (2016)
Title: The Violence of Identity
Core Message: Identification of the ego with various objects causes internal division. And all conflicts are a result of this inner division.
Excerpt: The more you are identified with your nationality, religion, ideals, thoughts, philosophies, the more violent, parochial, divided, and partisan you will be. Even if you're upholding the most charitable philosophy, you will still be internally violent. Therefore, all identity-based methods to prevent conflict, whether it's between family members or even between two large countries, will fail sooner or later. The only method that will never fail is that you do not remain who you are.

Title: Is India Just a Plot on a Map?
Core Message: Every boundary is a separation and separation leads to violence
Excerpt: The real India is not just a plot on a piece of paper. It is the India in which the openness of mind was first learned, where the Upanishads were born, and the land of Mahavira and Buddha. India is beautiful because it gave the world its first light of wisdom. That India is a very privileged and rare place, that is my India.

Link: In The Right Battle, Defeat Is Victory
Title: In The Right Battle, Even Defeat Is Victory
Core Message: If there is an inner conflict, and you know which side should win, fight hard to ensure that the right side prevails. Keep fighting even in defeat.
Excerpt: We all have our moments, our episodes of failures. We all let ourselves down at some time or the other. What to do then? Rule number one - do not go down tamely. If there is an inner conflict, and you know which side should win, fight hard to ensure that the right side prevails. Rule number two- Keep fighting till your victory and keep fighting in your defeat. Even in the defeat, remain a winner.

Title: Who Is An Indian Soldier?
Core Message: An Indian soldier upholds something worthy
Excerpt: A soldier is not just someone who is defending a piece of land or his own self-worth or ego. He is someone who knows the great principles that India stands for, realizes that those principles are worth defending and laying down his life for. An Indian soldier understands the soul of India, upholds something worthy and sublime.

Title:
How To Be A Good Mother?
What Is The Job Of A Mother
Core Message: Raising the consciousness of the child is the role of the mother
Excerpt: The mother's job must be to elevate the consciousness of the child. The mother should be a rightful teacher, not a birth giver. The task of giving birth must be according to Science, because that's a mechanical function, and that must be done by machines. But educating a child, invoking discretion and wisdom in a child, is not something a machine can do, and that's where the mother's role starts.

Title:
What Would Today’s Buddha Look Like?
Do You Display Buddha's Traits?
How Much Of A Buddha Are You?
Core Message: We need hundreds of youngsters to display the traits of Buddha today
Excerpt: Buddha had some core traits which remain the same today. A sharp mind and a certain curiosity in knowing the depths of life, not feeling that ‘I already know.’ Deep compassion, detachment, and an unending desire to reach the ultimate knowledge, not lazily concluding at one point. He shared his knowledge with the world. A practical man - raised an organization that became the dominant religion of the land. Today, in an age where religion has distorted,  we need hundreds of Buddhas.

Title: Are You Ready For True Love?
Core Message: Prepare yourself for love by removing the inner clutter that you have collected by the means of the body, environment, random chance, and circumstances.
Excerpt: The wise ones say, “Love arrives only when the right, clean, and honoured space has been prepared for it.” So, you can never find love — you can only rid yourself of all that blocks it; all that is needlessly and coincidentally present in your mental space. And you can’t predict how love will arrive. But you can do your homework to clear the inner clutter.

Title: Is It Wise To Pursue Your Interests?
Core Message: Interests come from conditioning and therefore, they are not the same as love. Do not pursue interests. Pursue something higher.
Excerpt: Interests come from your body, environment, and circumstances—they are not the same as love. So, if you're interested in a vocation, ask yourself: why do the interests of my five-year-old self seem so naive and immature when I'm twenty-five? And would I look at my current interests the same way ten years later? Wisdom lies in realizing that interest is the last thing you should pursue.

Title: Fighting The Right War
Core Message: The costs of war are huge. Therefore, when war is inevitable, it should arise from wisdom to serve a higher purpose.
Excerpt: War is a necessary evil. It takes a country away from the path of national development. One day of traditional warfare can cost ₹30,000–₹50,000 crores, excluding the loss of life, infrastructure, or capability destruction. Therefore, like all right action, the right war must arise from wisdom and discretion, not impulse or populist sentiment. And strategic retaliation must serve a higher purpose.

Title: Nuclear War: A Collective Suicide
Core Message: Nuclear war would be apocalyptic for the entire planet.
Excerpt: The impact of nuclear war would extend beyond national borders and threaten ecosystems worldwide. Nuclear radiation would pollute the air, water, and land for decades. A nuclear winter could cause agricultural collapse, starvation, and mass migration. Future generations would suffer deformities and chronic illnesses. Simply put, it would be apocalyptic for the entire planet. A Pyrrhic victory attained at such cost would be indistinguishable from defeat.

Title: The Two Types Of Education
Core Message: Real education is missing today
Excerpt: There is one kind of education that just deals with sustaining the body including earning money, shelter etc. The second kind of education which is completely missing, looks at that which is not mechanical - the awakening of the intelligence and the asking of the question,’WHO AM I?’. Ask your education if it is giving anything beyond the method to earn bread? If not then it is a very poor education.

Because if you are repeating things just as past generations would, you cannot have freedom or joy.

Title: Why Does Rejection Affect You?
Core Message: Rejection affects you because you make it a part of your self-assessment
Excerpt: When you get rejected, you think they have caused you to diminish, a fear of disappearance. A simple rejection affects you completely because you make it a part of your self-assessment as your own self-worth is dependent on others and hence limited. To remove this bondage you will have to remember what you are not, all the thoughts about yourself that keep you small and chained. @sarita.dudani@advait.org.in

Title: Are your goals really yours?
Core Message: The real struggle isn’t distraction—it’s choosing a goal that’s not worth your focus. When your goal is truly meaningful and liberating, staying committed becomes natural.
Excerpt:
You feel demotivated not because of distraction, but because your motive itself is unworthy. If you choose a goal that isn't worthy enough, it makes no sense to stay focused on it.

Don’t talk so much about how you get distracted. Instead, talk about how, in the first place, you made something into your goal.

Does your goal offer you unconditional joy, or lead you to freedom and liberation?
You will stay with your goal if it truly liberates you.

Title:
Why Are Our Youth So Misguided Today? 
or Why Do We Expect Our Youth To Be Like Swami Vivekananda?
Swami Vivekananda was a rare exception, not the norm
A Chimpanzee Cannot Just Turn Into a Vivekananda
Vivekanandas Are Not Born, They Are Made
Core Message: Swami Vivekananda is an exception, man is an animal who continuously want food, comfort, and sex.
Excerpt: If you start assuming that all young human beings should be like Swami Vivekananda, then you are missing the fact that a human is an animal that just continuously seeks food, comfort, and sex. It is utterly rare for him to feel a deep inner urge for liberation. Swami Vivekananda doesn't drop off from the sky. They are made— not by their mothers, but by somebody like Paramhans. It is a great exception!

Title: The Path Of Pleasure
Core Message: Pleasure is needed but it is important to choose a pleasure that elevates.
Excerpt: Pleasure is greatly important and we cannot live without it. But ask yourself: is my pleasure taking me higher or making me more of an animal? The right pleasure has to be carefully crafted with intelligence and devotion; and the wrong pleasure is like gravity - it just happens. For example, there is great joy in playing a great tennis shot. But there is also pleasure in playing an awful shot and smashing the racquet on the ground.

Title: If the Guru Eats Meat, Can the Seeker Too?
Excerpt: Liquor or flesh consumption, for sure, are obstacles — there is no doubt about it. Ramakrishna Paramhans found it very difficult to resist fish. Nisargadatta Maharaj was famous as ‘Beedi wale Baba.’ But in spite of liquor, flesh, or cigarettes, they could overcome those obstacles. That only proves the strength of their love. The common man does not have that kind of resolve. These kinds of things, even if they are observed in a realized man, must be respectfully kept aside. The seeker must look for that which is useful.

Link:
When a Guru Eats Meat || Acharya Prashant, on Raman Maharshi and Nisargadatta Maharaj
https://acharyaprashant.org/en/articles/when-a-guru-eats-meat-1_ba15dbd
Title: Why Do the Purest Words Often Go Unheard?
Core Message: On Truth, Utility, and the Teacher's Burden
Excerpt: The absolute truth is not useful—it doesn't speak to you. The more you seek utility; the more truth must be diluted. That’s why liberated ones often say things with an iota of falseness. The Brahma Sutras come as close to truth as words allow. But Ramakrishna Paramhans’s parables—simple stories for the common people—have helped far more. Yet the moment there’s dilution; the teacher becomes vulnerable to charges of falseness.

Link:
When a Guru Eats Meat || Acharya Prashant, on Raman Maharshi and Nisargadatta Maharaj

Title:
What Makes a Guru Useful or Harmful?
The Three Types of Gurus
Core Message: Three Types of Gurus
Excerpt: There are three kinds of gurus. One sits on the absolute peak—worshipped but unreachable. He is not useful. The second has seen that height, but steps down to speak in your language. He might dilute the truth to make it useful. The third has never been up, only seen pictures but sells illusions to serve his ego. That’s the fake Guru, necessarily harmful and ironically, the most accepted.

Link: Only a Buddha can really help others
Title: Who can live selflessly and really help others? Or Who really helps—one who is whole, or one who hopes?
Core Message: True Help
Excerpt:
True selfless living begins only when one has transcended personal desires—it is a grace known to the Buddha. Only in a state of complete inner fulfillment can one genuinely give or act for others. That is the righteous struggle: to live from wholeness. In contrast, living solely for personal time, freedom, money, thoughts, relationships, or choices—when driven by inner lack—reflects a wrong battle. Updated: Do We Live For Others?
Kindly get over this notion that we live for others. That is the privilege granted only to a Buddha. If you have a lot that is personal in your life, personal time, freedom, money, thoughts, relationships, choices - you will live only for this stuff. Being what we are, it is hardly possible for us to do anything for others. Living for others happens only to the one who has nothing personal to live for.

Title:
Heaven and Hell: Myth or Reality?

OR

Do Heaven and Hell Really Exist?
Excerpt: Heaven and hell aren’t afterlife fictions—they’re exactly where you stand, right now. The company you keep is your loka. As the Niralamba Upanishad says: Right company is heaven. Wrong company is hell. Vedanta is not some modern reinterpretation or ritual-bound relic; it is the very foundation of Bharat. You may call it something else, but eventually, you’ll return to it—because Truth has no second name.

Title: Ego: More Than Just Pride
Core Message: What is Ego? And how it causes fear and suffering.
Excerpt: A common misconception that many of us have is that Ego is pride - but it is far more pervasive than pride. It is the sum total of everything that we have taken from the outside and just accepted as our beliefs and identities without applying intelligence. But how can our identity be something that has come from the outside? We have an existence of our own. Ego is this forgetfulness of our pure existence.

Title: Yoga Is To Dance Without A Reason
Core Message: Yoga is to live to just express, not to become something
Excerpt:
Yoga is to dance without a reason.
Yoga does not mean following particular patterns. Yoga means to move about patternlessly and not to bother if you come across a pattern. To live to just express, manifest, talk, sing, walk, to let the entire system dance; dance for no reason; not to obtain anything, but just to say thank you because everything is so beautiful! Dance not because you will get paid; but because you already feel very well paid.

Title: Yoga Is To Dance Without A Reason
Core Message: Yoga is to not have anything to do with our actions. And when actions are left free, we become the true doer of actions.
Excerpt: Yoga does not mean following particular patterns. It means to move about patternlessly and not to bother if you happen to come across a pattern. Krishna says that you are a Yogi when you have nothing to do with your actions - you just let them be. And when you leave your actions free, you are the true doer. Otherwise, the world is making you do everything and situations are determining your life.

Title: Yoga Is To Dance Without A Reason
Core Message: Yoga is to dance without a reason or purpose or end.
Excerpt: Yoga does not mean following particular patterns; it means to move about patternlessly. It has been drilled deep in our minds that we live in order to achieve something. But this is not so. We live so that we may just express and let the entire system dance for no reason, no purpose, no end. Yoga is to dance without a reason - just to say thank you.

Title: What Blocks the Ever-Willing Grace?
Core Message: Grace waits for true surrender
Excerpt: When you truly want something, you won’t wait—you’ll cry out with every cell, “I want it now.” But the Truth comes and sits only on the cleanest, purest, highest seat—the throne reserved for it. If something or someone else is there, the Truth refuses to come. Only the Lord should be allowed there, no one else. You may remove ten things, but if you still remain, it stays out. The moment you truly allow—it happens.

Title: The Knowledge That Liberates is Vidya
Core Message: Vidya and Avidya are both about objective knowledge except that Vidya considers the subjects that seeks that knowledge. This is the knowledge that liberates.
Excerpt: Avidya is objective knowledge with no consideration for the subject that seeks that knowledge. Vidya is also objective knowledge but with consideration for the subject that seeks the knowledge. So, Vidya is the same as Avidya, except that in Vidya the teacher asks, "Why are you studying this? Where are YOU in all this?" This is real Vidya. And it is about this that it is said "That which liberates is Vidya".

Title: What Really Is Attachment?
Core Message: Attachment is not love—it’s ego-driven bondage. True union is dissolution, not craving. Attachment brings suffering, not fulfillment.
Excerpt:
Attachment is a superficial union—it’s not love.
It’s like you are with the wrong one, and not even prepared to see that you are with the wrong one — it is called ‘attachment’.
Your true intimacy isn’t attachment; it’s dissolution.
But in attachment, you remain yourself, craving the other. In love, you disappear.
Attachment is like a ‘Faustian bargain’ where you give up something very precious, for something very small.

Title: Separation and Unity
Core Message: Separation is a thought, Unity cannot be imagined
Excerpt: Separation is a thought. Unity is not a thought. If you will sit there and imagine that you and everybody here are one, then you’ll go mad, because unity cannot be imagined. It is enough to just check the imagination that you are separate. When you are disturbed and desirous, then you are acting upon something, a clear indication of separation. ‘Me reaching somewhere’ so ‘me’ and the ‘goal’ are separate. Sudeep Gowrishankar

Title: Is It Selfish To Love Oneself First?
Core Message: To love yourself is to parallelly, concurrently take care of both, yourself and the world.
Excerpt: If your definition of “yourself” separates you from the world, then this self that is separate from the world is anyway not worth loving, it is not the real you. Figure out who you are and your relationship with the world, then you will know that it is not possible to love yourself while being indifferent to the world. To love yourself is to parallelly, concurrently take care of both yourself and the world. Sudeep Gowrishankar

Title: JeevanMukti — The Highest Possibility?
Core Message: True spirituality reforms the world. Liberation isn’t after death—it’s living free, amidst life. That’s JeevanMukti—the highest possibility.
Excerpt: You cannot be truly spiritual and stay untouched by society’s suffering. And you cannot be a real reformer unless your actions arise from a free mind. The real sage doesn’t escape the world—he transforms it. JeevanMukti is not posthumous; it’s the rare flame that burns right in the middle of life, yet untouched by it. Liberation after death is easy to imagine. The challenge—and the possibility—is to be free while alive.

Title: Question Everything - Especially Yourself
Core Message: Nothing that we experience is beyond questioning because everything we see is seen by the seer, the Ego, and the Ego is not the Truth.
Excerpt: The Truth cannot be objectified or taken as a thing, place, person, or book. So, don't be too quick to accept your own assessments, judgements, likes, dislikes, and experiences. Whatever you're seeing is seen by "you" - the Ego - and you are no absolute. Everything must be available to enquiry, investigation, and questioning - and questioning cannot happen if you declare that you’ve already come to the Truth. Never believe that the journey has ended or that the ego itself is the Truth.

Title: Gita, Society and Its Wrong Interpretation!
Core Message: Misinterpretations of the Gita thrive because they comfort the desiring mind, not because they reflect Krishna’s true message.
Excerpt: A mind full of desires becomes insane. It forgets logic, loses sense of probability. You toss the dice 50 times and get a six — then say, “The deity has blessed me!” When it doesn’t work, you blame karma. “My karmic account is -20,000, so +500 blessings aren't enough.” The whole maze of beliefs is built just to keep you trapped inside.

Title: Feminism from Vedanta’s Perspective?
Core Message: Patriarchy isn’t just social; it’s biological. Vedanta says its roots lie in prakriti, so the solution must be spiritual, not ideological.
Excerpt:
From the Vedantic perspective, what is feminism? To approach that, we must first ask: what is patriarchy? Vedanta asks — where does it come from?
Patriarchy, it says, is not just a social construct or ideology. It’s a continuation of prakritik bondage — deeply rooted in our biological configuration.
Since it stems from biology, the solution can't be ideological, it has to be spiritual.

Title: The Afterlife: Truth or Distraction?
Core Message: Belief in the afterlife blinds us to reality—life is here and now. Truth begins when we stop chasing illusions beyond death.
Excerpt:
Afterlife is not even philosophy; it’s simply theology—present in every major religion. Science today confirms that nothing survives the body. So, for whom are heaven and hell?
Belief in the afterlife takes you away from the facts of life. You say this world means nothing, that you’re just a traveler here. But in doing so, you become blind to what is right in front of you. You stop seeing life as it is.

Title: Are You the Body, or Is the Body Yours?
Core Message: To identify with the body or to call it your own — both seem foolish, because the needs and demands of consciousness and the body are entirely different.
Excerpt:
The body that appears so much like yourself is actually composed totally of the world. It is very much a machine with its own movements, programming, limitations, and ways of functioning. This is the point at which the wise man asks, "Is there any way I can take this body seriously?
Then Ashtavakra says, "Neither I am this body, nor this body is mine."

Title: God vs. Truth
Core Message: God is a concept. Truth is not. Truth just turns you silent.
Excerpt: God and Truth are different things. What you call God is a concept; Truth is not a concept. Therefore, you can have stories about God, various religions, and their miscellaneous beliefs. But you can have no story at all about Truth because it is that which is invariable. Time cannot change it and it doesn't vary from person to person. Irrespective of your subjective state, it remains as it is. Truth just turns you silent.

Title:
Should You Practice Consciousness?
What is Conscious Practice?
Core Message: Conscious practice is the only possible way
Excerpt: The world will continue to exercise its charm over you, and you'll have to consciously negate it, deny it through practice. All practice involves discomfort,  pushing your boundaries, testing your limits and negating them. Practice means incremental, daily, moment-to-moment improvement. Step by step you have to move — even towards the absolute. No one step can take you to the absolute.

Title: Why Are Holy Scriptures Misinterpreted So Much?
Core Message: Scriptures are relative to the time they were written in. So it takes intelligence to interpret them correctly. And the interpretation depends on the reader's own light, intelligence, and spirit.
Excerpt: Most scripture is relative to the prevailing conditions of the time in which it was written. They are not absolute statements. So, it requires a certain intelligence on the part of the reader to draw out the real essence. The nonsense that happens in the name of religion was certainly not the intention of the founders of those religions. They gave what they could—but you take what you want.

Title: Vibes, Energy, Aura: New-Age Nonsense
Core Message:
What you experience comes from within you, not from others.
Vedant says — you are the source of all your experiences.
Excerpt: The culture today — to not look at yourself and look only at the world. The moment you talk of people as emitting good waves or bad waves, positive or negative vibrations, you completely stop looking at your own self. You start saying, “If I’m experiencing something, it is because of the object of experience.” Vedant says, “Son, you are the source of all your experiences.”  The ego itself, the experiencer. Do not take it very seriously.

Title:
You Can Either Be A Family Man Or Really A Vegan
Family System And Veganism Don't Go Together
Core Message: You cannot be vegan without being really spiritual
Excerpt: The institution of family stands on the pleasure principle, the man and the women, the mother and the father. And now you tell these two, who came together for pleasure, that you cannot have pleasure anymore. You give up your chai and such stuff. Why will they listen to you? Veganism says there is something far higher than pleasure. So, the family system and veganism just don’t go together. Sudeep Gowrishankar

Title: Is The Guru A Person?
Core Message: Guru is a continuity, taking different forms at different times.
Excerpt: Only the learner is a person. Never make this mistake of thinking of the Guru as a person! If you do, then you will only be interested in the Guru's personality, and you will miss the essence. The beloved can send you hundreds of letters but no letter is the beloved. The letter carries a fragrance of the beloved, but do not get attached to the letters, you will miss the beloved.

Title: Vibes And Auras: Destructive, New-age Nonsense
Core Message: To believe in vibes, auras, and energies is to worship the ego that leads to violence and suffering.
Excerpt: The cult that talks about vibes, auras, or energies, inflicts great damage upon you because it makes you stop looking at your own self. You say: "If I'm experiencing something, it's because of the object of experience." But in fact, your experience has little to do with the object -- it has much more to do with who you are. This is why the same person that gives you negative vibes gives positive vibes to somebody else. Therefore, it's wise to not take your experiences as the Truth.

Title: Does Truth Make You Useless?
Core Message: Spirituality liberates you from being a useful slave to others. Therefore the others will really dislike it when you turn spiritual.
Excerpt:
Ashtavakra says, “Truth makes the eloquent man dumb, the clever man stupid, and the energetic man lazy.”
You used to yak endlessly — then came a touch of Truth, and suddenly: awestruck! What to say? It feels stupid to express the non-sense within.
If you've been clever, Truth reveals the stupidity in your cleverness — so you drop it.
But the world sees only two states: cleverness, and its absence, which it calls stupidity.
Truth is for the innocent ones.

Title:
The Higher Self And The Lower Self
Are You Operating From Your Higher Self?
Core Message: What is good for the Self is good for the World
Excerpt: The lower self says "I am born to consume. If I can obtain stuff from the world, then I can get peace.” This comes from the lower self not knowing the true Self and therefore, it has a violent relationship with the world. But the higher self clearly recognizes who it is and what it needs. It sees that its interests and the interests of the world are not separable. This creates a beautiful relationship with the world.

Title: Vedanta Is Totally Immoral
Core Message: Vedanta deals squarely with the suffering of an individual, not morality
Excerpt: The word "morals" comes from masses - the code of conduct of masses. Vedanta has nothing to do with masses. Vedanta deals squarely with the individual, because all suffering is individual. You don't suffer in a crowd, you suffer all alone within. That’s what the Upanishads seek to address. You read so that you can get clues as to how to observe yourself better, as to what lies within.  Sudeep Gowrishankar

Title: The Working Woman's Guilt
Core Message: The guilt of millions of working women is coming from primitive conditioning from when we were hunter-gatherers in the jungle.
Excerpt: Millions of working women are continuously carrying guilt of neglecting an important duty in the household. This is emanating from centuries-old conditioning. As hunter-gatherers in the jungle, the woman would be continuously pregnant and immobilised. So, the man became the provider. But where is the jungle today? Why are we still behaving as if we are still in the jungle? There is no disadvantage that the woman has today - so there is no need for her to feel that her primary committment is at home.

Link: Do We All Participate in Rape Culture?
Title: Is Rape Culture the Symptom of a Deeper Mental Bondage?
Core Message: Woman as human being rather than female body.
Excerpt: Sri Ramakrishna Paramhans, the great saint, used to say that the ordinary person is driven by just two primary pursuits—kanchan (wealth) and kamini (sensual pleasure).The sex everyone chases isn’t merely a bodily need; it’s a craving of the mind. Unless this thinking changes through the wisdom of Saints and Shri Krishna, such painful, destructive acts will keep recurring.

Title: Are You Working Or Labouring?
Excerpt: Even animals have to do some work to run the body -- you can call this the labor of living. This is not Work. Work is what you do to satisfy your consciousness and that which offers contentment. And obviously, Work must be placed much higher than the labor of living. The trick is to satisfy the physical with the least amount of labor, so that you have time and resources to do the real Work. Labor is like a tax you pay for living; Work is the delight of life.

Title: Shakti Is Movement, Shiv Is The Destination
Core Message: Shiv and Shakti are inseparable
Excerpt: Shakti represents everything in motion, everything that can be experienced, everything in space-time. We move in search of a final destination. That point is symbolically represented by Shiv. Those who are inclined towards having the right kind of movement worship Shakti. Those who have fallen in love with the destination itself, worship Shiva. The fact is that the two are inseparable.

Title: What Is Consciousness?
Core Message: Anything that experiences is conscious, anything with active choice is conscious
Excerpt: Anything that experiences is conscious. Experience is the urge to not remain who you are. Using what you are perceiving, you want to change. Everything that limits your experience is a bondage. The one who realizes that bondage, and rebels against it, is a conscious entity. When you have a choice, unlike a stone, then you are conscious. A stone will undertake a long journey to have an active choice.

Title:
How to Find a Real Lover?

or 

What Makes Love Real?
Core Message: True love starts with truth. Don’t ask if someone loves you—see if they truly love the truth
Excerpt: Truth is the first thing. If you don't have love for the first thing or the first one, how can you have love for all the others you are related to? You don't need to ask — are you in love? Do you love me? All these are needless questions. The only question to be asked is, do you love the Truth? If the person loves the Truth, everything is fine.

Title: Validation — But From Whom?
Excerpt:
How will anybody know you really well? So even if others validate what you are saying or doing, does that hold any value?
The only person who know me well is me. If I have to ask somebody, I'll ask myself. If I have to ask, "How am I doing?" I'll ask myself. But that would require you to be impartial—"Nirmam."
That’s the word from the Gita: "Nirmam." 
That will require a certain detachment from oneself — a love for truth rather than for personal weaknesses.

Title: Loneliness And Love
Core Message: To be alone is to be with the right partner within
Excerpt: The "One" sitting within, the ego, has a tendency to keep looking towards many with hope of fulfillment, love, and completion. Do not to associate with this "One" sitting within. Within you is someone who is great company. Be with that one. To be alone is to be with the right partner within. Or if you cannot locate who that great one is, be with no one, it might actually be just enough for you. Sudeep Gowrishankar

Title: Is Affection The Opposite Of Intellect?
Core Message: Affection And Intellect Belong To The Same Plane, Real Love Doesnt
Excerpt: Intellect and affection go hand in hand because they both belong to the ego and the false kind of love. Attachment, ego, exploitation, the usual kind of emotional relationship goes with intellect. Real love does not go with intellect, it comes with intelligence. That's a different plane.

Title: Can You Find Love On Tinder And Bumble?
Core Message: Real love is a realization not an experience
Excerpt: Try it out. If that's what's going on, go get an experience. But you must have the intent to really test it for what it really is. Experience is one thing and realization is a totally different thing. You can live your entire life without knowing even a moment of love. Real love is a purely spiritual thing. You cannot have real love without having paid the price to earn spiritual education. Sudeep Gowrishankar

Title: What Is Om?
Core Message: Om is consciousness dissolving into silence
Excerpt: Om is sound finely dissolving into, tapering off into silence. This is analogous to the disappearance of the arrow mind into the Brahman target. And figuratively, we say that Om , comprising of a, u, m, (akār-ukār-makār ), representing the three states of consciousness, dissolves into silence. The mind, leaving behind all its three states, disappears into the target. And silence is the target.  Sudeep Gowrishankar

Title: Rebellion or Security — What Do You Want?
Core Message: True rebellion needs fearlessness. A self-protective mind can't rebel; only a carefree, trusting mind dares to risk everything for Truth.
Excerpt: The mind obsessed with its upkeep, security and welfare cannot rebel. Only a carefree, faithful and an assured mind can rebel. If you have to take care of yourself, then you have to be very careful. And there can be no rebellion in an environment of carefulness. To really rebel one has to be very dismissive of the outcome of the rebellion. One must have a mind that says, “Whatever comes is alright; whatever comes will be taken care of by something beyond me.

Title: The Myth Of Free Will
Core Message: Vedanta says that there is no need for free will. You need understanding and then choice does not matter. There is an effeortless flow towards the right action.
Excerpt: Neuroscience says there is no free will. Vedanta also comes to the absence of free will, but through the route of choiceless understanding. It says that the right action will never be a product of your choice because there's no such thing. The right action happens when you just don't see options -- not because you're an idiot, but because you're in love with the right one. So, you don't require choice. You require to understand through observation. And only then, you don’t have to choose. It’s an effortless flow.

Title: Poor Billionaires, Loveless Weddings
Core Message: The framework in which one is successful only when they are ahead of others needs to be dropped for real success.
Excerpt: Your entire identity comes from the world -- society religion, family, tradition. Had your identity been independent of the world, then you wouldn't have needed to get ahead or prove anything to the world. And when there is more internal hollowness and insecurity, there is more need to ostentate, and the more lavish the wedding is. So, the fundamental problem is the framework in which you cannot be successful without being ahead of the world. Real success is when you drop this framework.

Title: Clean Your House Before You Escape To The Hills
Core Message: Everything around us is nature and everything can be used to understand what nature really is. Without this understanding, we are only going to destroy nature.
Excerpt: Had it been greatly liberating to spend a week in the hills, then those who are spending their entire lifetime in the hills should have been automatically liberated. But instead of liberation, you see a hell of a lot of superstition. So, mindless adventure trips or picturesque trails will not help. Do we want to go to the hills to really change our lives or to shed our tension and continue the same old routine?

Title: What Does Vedanta Say About Feminism?
Core Message: Vedanta says: You’re not just a body or gender—true freedom comes when you rise above all identities, not just fight for equality.
Excerpt:
Vedanta says that the body of the woman is her cage, just as the body of the man is the man's cage. 
‘Vedantic feminism’ says, “Disown your physical self—you are much beyond that, girl. As long as you identify with the body, enjoy being called a girl or woman, there’s no freedom for you—and the same goes for the man. Saying ‘I am the woman, I am the man’ is the real problem.”
Equality is a high ideal, but liberation is the purpose of life.

Link: Controversy: Is Sanatan Dharma a Disease?
Title: Sanatan Dharma: Eternal Wisdom or Cultural Trap? OR Is Sanatan Dharma Misunderstood or Misused?
Core Message: What defines Sanatan Dharma?
Excerpt: The human mind suffers because it does not comprehend what’s happening within itself. It longs to understand how to free itself from this suffering. The responsibility to find an end to the suffering, a way out solution--belongs to every person, in every era, and in every part of the world. This timeless inquiry, relevant across all boundaries, is what defines Sanatan Dharma. It is a philosophy of the mind that gives a purpose to life.

Title: Who Is To Blame For The Crime?
Core Message: Tackle the criminal's center not the crime
Excerpt: There are three approaches that we typically take for any kind of crime: blame the individual, the system, or the society and its culture. But, in each of these approaches, one wants to say that somebody else is to be blamed, and is conveniently avoiding looking at oneself. Hence, a fourth approach is needed - the crime proceeds from the criminal at the centre, from his identity. That has to be changed.

Title: How to Raise a Daughter Rightly?
Core Message: One wrong role model can derail your daughter’s life. Show her real greatness—only then will shallow idols lose their charm.
Excerpt:
If you don't know what kind of highness is possible, then any kind of lowness will become the gold standard for you. 
One wrong role model can mislead your daughter into distorted attitudes, shallow lifestyles, and ultimately, wrong life decisions. But this can be corrected very easily—just give her the right role models. 
Introduce her to women truly worthy of being remembered. Once she’s spent a week with Marie Curie, how will she respect Pari?

Title: Cruelty vs Compassion — Just Two Sides of the Same Coin?
Core Message: Compassion isn’t the opposite of cruelty—selfish attachment often is. True compassion not come from the center of ego.
Excerpt: The opposite of cruelty is not compassion. More often, it is attachment, possessiveness, or caring selectively out of self-interest. Real compassion is when you are not operating from the center of ego at all. It’s not about the ego wearing a pleasant face. This is just a very silly kind of tactic that people use to justify their cruelty. Compassion is what makes us human.

Title: Why Doesn't the Law of Karma Apply to Animals?
Core Message: Humans can choose between instinct and higher values. That choice shapes their life. Animals lack this choice, so karma doesn't apply to them.
Excerpt:
The law of karma does not apply to animals because they do not really have a choice in their actions. And when there is no choice, there is no question of reward or punishment. 
Human beings are in a peculiar situation. They can choose to side with their animalistic conditioning or something higher — freedom, joy, love, liberation, compassion. 
How you exercise that choice decides your life. Choose very, very carefully.

Title: Do You Really Know India?
Core Message: Being born in India doesn’t make one truly Indian; real love for India comes only through deep understanding, not mere attachment.
Excerpt: If India is just the birthplace of your body to you, then there is nothing special in India. Just by being born somewhere in India, you do not become an Indian. You do not really grow love for India, because love requires understanding. You can develop some kind of attachment to your territory, but that is not love. If you understand India, you’ll also know whether India deserves to be served.

Title: Violent Family Murders
Core Message: Grotesque violence does not happen suddenly. It was always there. It is just that we are blind to it because of our fears and desires.
Excerpt: Just because we don't hear gunshots doesn't mean that things are peaceful between partners or between parents and kids — especially daughters. Not at all. There are clear boundaries and those boundaries have been mined. As long as you remain within the boundaries, you will entertain the illusion that you are free and loved. Try to step out, and you'll be blown to pieces. So, the violence was always cooking but you didn't see it because you were blinded by your emotions, need for security, and condtioning.

Title: Abortion Laws: Morality Without Responsibility?
Core Message: Before opposing abortion, ensure support systems exist to care for saved babies. If you can't take responsibility, let the woman decide.
Excerpt: Being the state, one thing I said is that we should have had institutions. If I want to take an anti-abortion stand, then I should have had institutions, first of all, for taking care of babies saved from abortion. That is the first thing. If you are so interested in the baby, you take ownership of the baby right now. But if we can't take ownership of the baby, then it's the woman's baby, and let her do what she wants to do.

Title: What is The Right Relationship With Prakṛti ?
Core Message: You are the Puruṣa — the conscious subject. All you experience is Prakṛti. Observe it with reverence, not with the intent to possess or exploit.
Excerpt: Who are you? That’s classically called the Puruṣa — that refers to consciousness. And what is everything that you can experience, perceive, think of, talk of, mandate? That is called Prakṛti. So, you are the subject — Puruṣa — and all your objects are called Prakṛti. So, go close to the Prakṛti. Observe it, know it, have reverence towards it, but do not aim to own it, possess it, exploit it, or consume it. That’s the right relationship.

Title: Morality: An Excuse For Waging War
Core Message: Wars are a product of humans remaining beasts. There is no moral basis for any war today.
Excerpt: Today's wars are all just a game of our primitive instincts. That is, anything that threatens my survival has to be obliterated - this is Pṛakṛti and the entire game of evolution for microbes, plants, birds, and animals. But as human beings, we want to pretend that these actions have some moral basis - they do not. We are beasts in human form and that's how we are born. And as long as we remain beasts, this will continue. Wisdom is the solution. And you don't need it to become enlightened - you need it so that you can become a human being.

Title: What Does Cleanliness Really Mean?

Excerpt: When we talk about cleanliness, we think of spotless homes and litter-free streets. But is that all? Cleanliness isn’t just shine and glitter — it’s about how our actions affect society, nature, and the mind. Something may look clean but still be harmful. Real cleanliness means living consciously — sensitive to oneself, others, and the planet. True cleanliness starts inside us. You’re truly clean only when you have clarity within.

Title: What Is Truly Right for You — and How to Find It

Excerpt:
First, ask yourself: who is making the choice within? Who's placing these options before you?
Doing or not doing—both are functions of the doer, right? Know who you are. Know what it is that you lack. Know what it is that you need to shed. And then the deed is right. Then you know the one right direction for you—unambiguously, choicelessly. It's not just about doing something. It's about knowing the doer. Know why there must be movement at all.

Title: Karma Applies to Whom — Humans or Animals?
Core Message: Humans can choose between instinct and higher values. That choice shapes their life. Animals lack this choice, so karma doesn't apply to them.
Excerpt:
The law of karma does not apply to animals because they do not really have a choice in their actions. And when there is no choice, there is no question of reward or punishment.

How you exercise that choice decides your life. Choose very, very carefully.

Title: Is It Ok To Be Lost?
Core Message: It is important to be lost, then you know you are not home
Excerpt: It’s when you are lost, that you realize that it was very important to be lost, otherwise, you would have kept telling yourself that you are home. Life by way of shock and defeat, reveals to you that you are still very far from home, and then you are more careful. Enter into Maya’s den, if you do not, then you will never discover her firepower. Next time, you will be more careful.

Title: Why Should Western Seekers Come To India?
Core Message: India will be magical for you if you are deeply in love with realization
Excerpt: A lot of people from the west come to India, thinking that the land itself will do something magical to them. The land will do nothing on its own. One has to probe himself, to know himself. The process is Upanishadic, of deep discussion and deliberation. If you are madly in love with realization, then India can bless you with something very magical. Otherwise, India is just an overcrowded place.

Title: Can I Choose Realization?
Core Message: You cannot choose realization., but you can choose to impede it
Excerpt: You cannot choose to realize. But you can choose not to realize. You have the free will to impede realization through your nuisance value. So you can only not become an obstacle in your own realization. You can withdraw. It's all about negation - “Neti-Neti, Nakar.” When realization happens, it is an expression of who you really are. Sudeep Gowrishankar

Title: Good Thoughts vs. Bad Thoughts
Core Message: Good thoughts are not about conclusions. They are about becoming more open to knowing.
Excerpt: Bad thought says "I know and there is no need to know any further" and as a result, becomes a barrier against knowing. On the other hand, good thought removes barriers against knowing. In fact, it works against itself because it is keen to know and expose the thinker. It comes to scrub away the bad thoughts and then, doesn't stay a moment longer. So, wisdom is not about coming to a conclusion -- it is about becoming open and available to knowing.

Title: What Is Shiva's Caste?
Core Message: Shiva cannot have a caste since he is not even the body
Excerpt: Shiv is not the organs — nose, eyes, tongue — not even the mind or the intellect. Then how can Shiv be a body? And if Shiv cannot be a body, then how can Shiv have a caste? Any kind of distinction — gender, class, ideology, shape — is inapplicable to Shiv. Shiv is not someone you can think of, but because we are bodily, our ego does not allow us to admit that there can be anything beyond who we are. Shiv is pure consciousness, unadulterated bliss — that's who Shiv is.

Title: Truth Is Formless
Core Message: All forms of gods and goddesses are projections of the human mind and therefore, we are only worshipping our own form through them. Truth is formless.
Excerpt: All forms of gods and goddesses have emerged from man's mind -- they are our own projections. Even if you show a god in the form of an animal, the animal will still be anthropomorphic with human thoughts and intentions. So, this proves that we are worshipping our own form. Therefore, if any form does not remind you of a Truth beyond the form, then the form has not succeeded on you. This is why the highest spiritual philosophies have always said that the Truth is formless.

Title: Who Needs Work-Life Balance?

Something you can give everything to, without regret. When there is love, there’s no finish line—only desire ends.

Title: Respectability Is Slavery

But what is the point of being big, rich, and powerful if it is still the small ones that call the shots for you? And this is not exclusive to the successful ones. Every single person who does not know the foundations of living will live in a secondhanded way - secondhanded love, success, and respect. And this will not allow you any kind of peace.

Title: Why Are Women A Problem For Mainstream Religions?

Therefore, when real religion shows up, it will deeply frustrate the traditional kind of religionists.

Title: The Woman Must Rebel
Core Message: Woman needs to rebel against the body, else she will continue to be exploited
Excerpt: The woman is the more oppressed of the two genders. And therefore the revolution must arise from the woman. Woman by rebelling against the body will be the harbinger of a revolution that will liberate entire mankind. She cannot be a creature of the nest. As long as the nest exists the woman will be exploited. The woman will have to actively rebel against the nest. There has to be a total revolution.

Title: Who Is Your Real Friend?
Core Message: If you are rooted in pleasure, your friends will also be those who give you pleasure, and your greatest transformative chance is gone
Excerpt: If there is one thing that can totally transform and liberate you, it is company. But if you are a die-hard pleasure seeker then who would be your friend? Somebody that gives you pleasure. But pleasure only knows its own gratification and shamelessly pursues it. Once you are rooted in pleasure, you become deaf to all wisdom and light. So, the greatest, and probably only chance of liberation that you had is now gone.

Title: Can Men And Women Be Just Friends?
Core Message: If you cannot be friends with a person of the opposite gender, an important part of you will be left unaddressed.
Excerpt: A friend is someone you can relate to in a way that uplifts your life, and gives you clarity and insight. So, why isn't it possible to be with a person of the opposite gender who gives sharpness to your consciousness and a better understanding of life? If you cannot be friends with a person of the opposite sex, an important part of you will remain unnourished, unawakened, uneducated, and unaddressed. It is the mark an awakened and spiritual society that men and women will be freely mingling with each other.

Title: Glued to the phone- Is there a solution to this distraction?

When you bring something meaningful and beautiful into your life than you'll have no time for those petty phone distractions.

Title: Check Your Krishna Quotient
Core Message: We think we know Krishna by hearing a few stories that are not even in the Gita. To know Krishna, one must go to the Gita.
Excerpt: Why is it that all my life I've been inviting people to the Gita, and speaking for hours on every single verse, and yet, there are not too many interested people? It's because you are fully confident that you know Krishna by hearing five stories that are not even in the Gita. There is a lot of trash in our spiritual heritage -- let's be honest and acknowledge that. Because if you do not keep the trash aside, you will not be able to value the jewels.

Title: Aligning Priorities In A Diverse World
Core Message: Without knowing the True Self, it is not possible to have anything in common between various stakeholders. And without anything in common, all we will have are divisions and conflicts.
Excerpt: We are all distinctly different people -- our genders, ages, religions, and houses are all different. Despite this, there is something that we all commonly value. If that is revealed, then the fault lines disappear. But without it, all you have are divisions, conflicts, and wastage of energy. This common meeting point is the subject matter of all philosophy -- particularly Vedant. If you really want to unite people coming from different backgrounds, both of them have to be devoted to one common thing. Vedant calls it 'Atman' -- the True Self.

Title: Why Are We Failing To Protect Our Planet?
Core Message: Climate change is a problem of blind consumption and you cannot address the issue without asking the spiritual questoin of "Who is the consumer?"
Excerpt: Climate change is a problem of consumption. And you cannot address consumption without talking of the consumer -- who is he really? And that is the spiritual and Vedāntic question that is right at the center of the issue. If we don't consume with careful consideration, consumption will destroy our inner and outer worlds. Inwardly, it pushes us deeper into the false belief that by means of increased consumption, we will be able to rid ourselves of our inner disquiet. Outwardly, we destroy life for everybody on the planet because all consumption comes from this ecosystem.

As a partner — wonderful. And for the right work, if you have to start a concern, become an entrepreneur. But the objective must not be entrepreneurship, it must be right work.

Title: Do You Know Why You Love India?
Core Message: India cannot be loved without knowing its values that are worth worshipping that lie in Vedanta.
