If you have to fall in love with something, then the thing must have a sacredness, beauty, a certain beyondness to it. So, if you are to really love India, you have to know the values that constitute it, the people who worship those values, and the values must be worth worshipping. It is risky for most people to acknowledge it, but the base of the Indian nation are the values that come from Vedanta.

Title: Salvation within Sansar
Core Message: Salvation is in this Sansar, you cannot go anywhere else
Excerpt: It is in this world that you locate the genesis of your suffering, and do whatever you have to do. It is here that you have to ask yourself — if I really do value love, is there love at my workplace? If I value realization, do I realize what it means to be a mother? It is in the middle of this Sansar that you'll have to ask these questions, that you have to seek salvation. You cannot go anywhere else. Sudeep Gowrishankar

If you have to look at Shri Krishna as Sagun (which has qualities that can be seen/felt by senses) or Sakar (which has a form), then you have to be receptive to all images. And if you look at him as Nirgun Nirakar, then you know that there can be no image. The problem starts when one image becomes very dear to you.

Title: The Method of Shri Krishna
Core Message: The method of Krishna is the method of wait
Excerpt: Shri Krishna does not try to save undeserving and unripe people who are still sticking to prakriti. He says, “You take your time. I’m not going to pluck you away from your mother.” So, the method of Shri Krishna is just the method of wait, the method of patience. It does nothing. It just waits. He waits for the ripe one. And when the ripe one is there, his ripeness itself becomes the grace of Shri Krishna.

Title: Sex and Menstruation: Why is Religion so Obsessed?
Core Message: Culture and practice that are based on beliefs must be rejected because there is no space for beliefs, assumptions, or traditions in philosophy and true religion.
Excerpt: You have inflated the reproductive process much beyond its worth. Psychologically, a girl carries it throughout her life as something big, whereas it's nothing -- just another process in the human body. And because of the stigma you have attached to this purely biological thing, countless women suffer silently because they can't openly talk about gynecological problems. Indian philosophical systems have zero space for any belief, assumption, or tradition. So, obviously this culture has to be outrightly rejected.

Title: The Devotees' Lust
Core Message: The lust for remaining separate and enjoying God is of little value compared to the merger with the Truth.
Excerpt: All along the path of devotion, devotees have thrived on a sense of separation because this is that gives them a sense of appreciation. But this enjoyment is of very little value. If there is a lust to remain separately alive in order to enjoy, you have committed a double fallacy. First, you have turned God into an object. And second, you have valued your individuality over the merger into the Truth.

Title: Beyond waking, dream, and sleep—what is Turiya?
Core Message: Turiya is not a fourth state, it is the timeless background.
Excerpt: Beyond the three states of consciousness—Jagrati (waking), Swapna (dreaming), and Sushupti (deep sleep)—lies Turiya, not a fourth state but the silent background, the witness behind them all. When the body dies, waking, dreaming, and deep sleep disappear, yet Turiya remains untouched. For Turiya is not ‘yours’; the waking state belongs to the person and ends with death, but Turiya neither begins with the person nor ends with the person.

We give preference to the trivial and miss out on the important. We are drifting from one thing to another, with no thing meaning anything to us. You are not missing the secret; you are missing the obvious.

Title: Street Dogs: The Harsh Truth Nobody Admits
Core Message: There are only two options for stray dogs: integration into our families or extinction.
Excerpt: Stray dogs need garbage. So, the dog populations in urban areas are bound to reduce because the availability of waste has reduced dramatically. And it is not just that human beings suffer because of stray dogs. Dogs also suffer. Look at how they live, what they eat, how they get crushed by vehicles, get beaten up, fall ill, etc. So, you cannot wish them to be around. But they can be inside our homes and we can take due care and responsibility. There are only two options for stray dogs -- integration into our families or extinction.

Title: Blunders Are A Blessing
Core Message: Blunders force Man to confront their brutality
Excerpt: It's a blessing when we commit blunders that can no longer be hidden. Only then we are forced to admit that we are operating from the wrong center. That's why there have been turning points in spirituality when man has killed his saints- that's when you are forced to confront your brutality. These opportunities are opportunities of redemption. And then unscripted things happen.

Living Totally
Core Message: Living totally means living from a center that is not hungry
Excerpt: Doing something totally means doing it from a point of totality. It does not mean how far you go in doing that thing. It is not the action that matters, it is the point of origin of the action that matters. Action will be dictated by situations, but your center cannot be. Living totally means I operate from a point within me that is not hungry, that lives in its own internal satisfaction.

What Is Niskaama Karma?

The work becomes its own reward. You can call it love. There is so much love in it that there is no need left to desire anything from the future. Whatever could have been obtained is being obtained right now in the process of the work itself.

So, you don’t need just a few methods, you actually need infinite methods. And the right method, suitable for that moment cannot come from idealism or memory, it can come only from being present and having the courage to try the unknown, and to let it happen. Sudeep Gowrishankar

Core Message: When you are not trying to change the other, that is when you become an agent of change.
Excerpt: Change does not happen when you are actively trying to change the other, that is some kind of violence. Is it not an act that is beyond you? Are you not trying to play God?  When you are not trying to change the other, that is when you become an agent of change. When you are living in a carefree way, in not really bothering for the other, you are actually displaying a great compassion for the other.  Sudeep Gowrishankar

Title: When Does A Woman Become A Woman?
Core Message: The other gender arises only when you are identified with your gender.
Excerpt: A woman becomes a woman, the moment she thinks of a man. Otherwise she is just consciousness. Both man and woman are just objects of witnessing. If he can see the entire process- somebody was standing in his vacant emptiness, and then a woman crosses him, and simultaneously the man in him wakes up, and the woman comes in existence, then he is able to stand separately from both man and woman and look at them.

Excerpt: The real problem is, that you don’t ‘know’ the problem. Had you really known the problem, the problem would have very quickly faded away. Whenever you come across a problem, do not begin by saying that, this is the problem and now I am going to solve it. First of all, drop all your pretentions about your understanding. You do not know anything, so you have to start from an absolute Zero. You observe.  Sudeep Gowrishankar

Title: What Is Love?
Core Message: Love leaves no space for you to hide and survive
Excerpt: ​​The object of love is so big, so total, so filling, so occupying, that it leaves no space for the subject to hide and survive. The task is so damn big, that it can’t be done if you protect yourself. If you protect yourself, it won’t happen. Love involves a lot of bloodshed and demolition. And there are fireworks. Great structures collapse. Formidable enemies have to be defeated. All that is love.

Title: Is Seeking An Escape?
Core Message: It is better to Seek with all its dangers, than not seeking at all
Excerpt: On one hand, there is great danger that if you seek light, you will seek the wrong kind of light; you will just seek darkness disguised as light. On the other hand, there is the equally dark option of not seeking at all. Between these two possibilities, I seek the possibility of seeking the Light, with all its associated dangers. Because that is still better than not seeking at all. Isn’t it better to die fighting in the battle, than not fight at all?

Title: Climate Change: A Crisis Of Honesty
Core Message: Climate change deniers are not ignorant of the facts but more importatly, they lack honesty because the education system doesn't teach them honesty.
Excerpt: Climate change is assaulting us right within our homes. It is just that right now, the most underprivileged are bearing the brunt and the luckier ones are able to afford negligence. Not that they don't know the facts, but they are able to afford to neglect them for now. And what to do when one knows the facts, yet wants to deny them? Therefore, problem is not education, it is honesty. Your education system is not teaching honesty -- it is only teaching external things, nothing internal.

Title: If a Teen Asks: What’s the First Step to become good human?

Excerpt: When you are young, your first responsibility is to build yourself. Your earliest nourishment comes from mastering your school textbooks — truly immersing yourself in them. A book is not just for passing exams or moving to the next class; it shapes the person you will become. A strong foundation will carry you far, while its absence leaves many struggling for life. Spend time in the library, cherish your books, engage in meaningful discussions with worthy people, and choose uplifting, decent content online.

Title: What's In A Name?
Core Message: One way of living relies on names and memories, another lives directly, immediately
Excerpt: When something takes a name, it takes a lot of meaning. Now, it is not merely a person; the fellow is now a story. I look at you, and the old storybook opens. There is a way of living that relies on memory, that relies on storybooks. There is another way of living that does not rely on names and associations. It lives directly, immediately, it is not carrying wounds from the past.  Sudeep Gowrishankar

Title: The River of Self Knowledge
Core Message: Joy is found on the river of self-knowledge
Excerpt: Self-knowledge is about seeing the self in its activities in motion, constantly. If you can see yourself clearly, without motivation, then the seeing itself is great fun. Self-knowledge dissolves both happiness and sadness, and you are left with nothing but a naked and silent Joy. It is to be found, where you are, on the river of self-knowledge.

Title: AI: The Revolution You Cannot Miss
Core Message: AI is a huge opportunity to unleash the power of knowledge like never before.
Excerpt: The kind of knowledge that AI puts in the hands of the common man today is unprecedented. And it must be put to the best possible use. Think of all the evils that we suffer. Don't they come from our false beliefs? AI is the litmus test. If you believe in something, go test it with AI. You may not get the vertiable truth itself. But the chances are that you will get something much better than what you currently believe in. AI is a huge opportunity and those who are missing out are doing themselves a great disservice.

Title: Desire and Duty: A False Divide
Excerpt: We assume ambition must cost responsibility, and responsibility must sacrifice aspiration. The issue isn’t what to choose, but why we believe we must choose at all. And when we try to balance ambition and virtue — weekdays for profit, weekends for peace, it only deepens the divide. However, when clarity arises, harmony follows: desire is no longer restless, duty no longer heavy. What you do for yourself naturally serves the world. In that understanding, life becomes one movement: peaceful, clear, and undivided.

Title: Real Climate Crisis Outside—or Within Us?
Core Message: The true crisis is within us—our greed and disorder. Heal the inner self, and the outer climate will also begin to heal.
Excerpt:
We often ask how to save the climate, but what if the real crisis is within us? Profit is still profit, greed is still greed. If we cannot respect the rights of living, breathing people around us, how can we expect to respect something as abstract as the climate? 
At the heart of it, everyone is searching for a better life. When we begin to heal that inner disorder, the outer climate too finds a way to heal.

Title: What is Real Growth?
Core Message: Inner growth isn’t about adding more but cleansing the inner mess. True success is measured by one thing: does it bring welfare to the self?
Excerpt: We are born with certain tendencies—fear, greed, jealousy—that form a preexistent mess within. As life goes on, more unnecessary clutter gets added. Inner growth is not about adding but cleansing, reducing, and rectifying. And every bit of external success must be measured against one simple output: has it really contributed to the welfare of the self?

Title: Queen-Prisoner of the House
Core Message: We use decorated phrases to deceive ourselves when we are living lives of low consciousness.
Excerpt: Irrespective of your station in life, it's been drilled very deeply into Indian women that their life is first and foremost about the husband, the kids, the bed, and the meals. How can this be the primary reason for the existence of a conscious human being? We use decorated phrases like "Queen of the House" but the moment the queen gets some money, all her queenly tasks are dumped onto somebody else. So, it's just that we live very lowly lives and then justify them to deceive ourselves.

Title: What is Good and What is Evil?
Core Message: Only insecurity speaks the language of good and evil.
Excerpt: In the universe, there is no good, no evil. Ask instead, ‘To whom is good, and to whom is evil?’ The self, the ‘I,’ the ‘me,’ the one who wants to define good, the one who wants to define evil, he is evil, because he does not exist. Spirituality is giving the evil something right to do. If you do not give the evil the right thing to do, it will pick something else, making it feel relevant whereas the fact is that it has zero relevance. Work to remove yourself. That's your task.

Title: Breaking Through The Cycle Of Exploitation In Relationships
Core Message: When relationships are based on security, dependency and exploitation follow. The individual needs to be reformed to have self-knowledge and awareness.
Excerpt: We must ask why most marriages are based on superficial factors like appearance, caste, or family approval rather than deeper considerations. When marriage is based on a pursuit of security rather than wisdom and awareness, it can lead to dependency and exploitation. India’s challenges stem from deeply rooted societal norms and inadequate legal implementation. While legal reforms are necessary, the ultimate solution lies in societal transformation. And societal transformation means reforming the individual to have mental depth -- and self-knowledge is the only path.

Title: Title: Homes as Graves: Why Outrage Never Ends Violence
Core Message: Outrage after each tragedy of women violence has become a ritual, but only inner clarity can help
Excerpt: Every few months, the nation gets shaken by a horrifying report of a young woman’s death in her marital home. Outrage after each tragedy has become a ritual, but rituals cannot cure the blindness of the mind. Domestic violence, dowry, and oppressive marriages are symptoms of a deeper poverty: absence of inner clarity. Without clarity, there can be no love; without love, greed is the default, and violence is inevitable.

Title: Climate Change Is Not A Problem -- It's A Catastrophe
Core Message: Climate Change is a catastrophe, not just a problem and it is due to the wrong philosophy of life that we are living.
Excerpt: Climate change is not merely a problem -- everything is going to change and the planet will become uninhabitable not only for us humans, but for all species. Mass extinction is what we are staring at -- in fact, it has already started. But we do not discuss this because it challenges our basic philosophy of life that says "more is better". The climate crisis is a product of a wrong way of living. Therefore, taking Vedanta to every household is striking at the very roots of the climate crisis.

Title: How Can the Total Be Known?
Core Message: We see only the partial, yet call it the total. The wise admit: mind knows little; true humility lies in knowing our limits.
Excerpt:
We never know the total. The mind, the senses, the grasping power—are all limited. We look only at the partial, yet we are not humble enough to admit that we are men of parts. What do we do? We term the part as the total.
The total is obviously beyond our reach. But if it is beyond reach, one possibility still remains: to be totally humble, to admit that whatever the mind can know is little and partial.

Title: The Spiritual Battle Within
Core Message: The inner battle is the battle of the ego between Truth and Maya
Excerpt: The ego-sense wants to reach the Truth, but is being blocked and bewitched by Prakriti, Maya, the world. That is the inner battle. On one hand is love, on the other hand is conditioning. The ego is poised between Truth and Maya. Anybody who is fighting the force of Maya is a warrior. Your victory lies not in the outcome, but in the fight.  Teach your mind that only one greed is acceptable — the greed towards Truth.

Title:
How Many False Teachers Do You Have?
Why Do I Need A Teacher?
Core Message: You need a teacher because you have 10000 false teachers
Excerpt: Purely by himself, a teacher is just nobody, a blankness, an absence. But He is useful when you are occupied with the rubbish of your world. The rubbish, he clears it away. And when there is no more of rubbish, He himself is gone. The utility of the teacher is only because you have ten thousand other teachers — false teachers. Had you had no false teacher, you require no teacher.

Title: What Does It Mean To Be A Teacher?
Core Message: A teacher means a nobody
Excerpt: It means I cannot carry a particular personality that I feel comfortable in. I cannot say that ‘It is no good to laugh because my motive is serious.’ or that ‘I will not compromise on my own values for the students’ sake.’ or that “Truth is the prerogative of those with intelligence and I do not care whether most people understand me or not.’ It means I am a nobody.

Title: Why Go To A Teacher?
Core Message: You go to a teacher as a lover, not to get something you need
Excerpt: The relationship between teacher and student is not that of the giver and the taker, it is that of a lover and the lover. Yes, the student comes to learn a lot, but learning cannot be the purpose, the central reason is love. The first time you go to him, you go to him because you seek something. Then when you go to him, you go to him because you do not need anything, you go as a lover.

Link: False Teacher and The will of God? || Acharya Prashant, on Jesus Christ (2016)
Title: Who Is A False Teacher?
Core Message: Know a false teacher by seeing whether they have liberated you or put you in greater bondage
Excerpt: Just see what their presence does to you. Are they really able to bring peace and lightness to you? Are they really able to remove fear from your mind or are they putting you in greater fear? Do not know them by their forms, medallions, all the respect that society gives them. Know them by one criteria only— Have they liberated you or have they put you in greater bondage.

Title: How Does A Fraudulent Spiritual Teacher Arise?
Core Message: The common man who doesnt question is responsible for the rise of fraud teachers
Excerpt: An ecosystem where people have lost the sense to enquire, is where a fraudulent spiritual teacher emerges. He says, “The entire population is ready to be fooled, the moment is ripe for me to dominate their minds.” And so he ascends very steeply. Nobody is going to dissent and question. The main culprit is not the one who propagates such falsehood; it is the common man who is living a life of self-deception.

Title: Why Must I Listen To The Teacher?
Core Message: The Teacher has a conscious agenda to uplift you, life doesn't
Excerpt: In life, you will meet a few great teachers and a lot of stupid people. Be very judicious – ‘Who is it that you are listening to?’ This answer will decide your fate. Don’t remain open and available to everybody. When there is a teacher, the teacher has a conscious agenda to uplift you. Life has no conscious agenda to uplift you. Life is just like an input-output box – Garbage in, garbage out.

Title: The Teacher Is The Purest imperfection
Core Message: A physical teacher is bound to be imperfect
Excerpt: A physical teacher is bound to be a little imperfect at least. The teacher is receiving something in silence, but he has to translate it in your worldly language, so words would always carry some noise. That noise is not the intention of the teacher — it is his helplessness. Be highly respectful towards the words, but also know that the real thing is a little beyond these words.

Title: Discovering Your True Responsibility
Core Message: Our true duty is not external work, but inner purification—self-knowledge reveals responsibility, all else is just noise.
Excerpt: How do you know what your duty or responsibility is? We do not know what to do because we do not consider who we are. If I am someone unfulfilled, then obviously I need some betterment and respite. Your real duty is that which elevates, cleanses, and purifies your consciousness; all else is trivia. The deeper your self-knowledge, the lesser will be your need for any external code of conduct.

Title: Mass Extinction
Core Message: 1000 species are getting extinct every day
Excerpt: Mass extinction means that 99% of the species will go extinct. Our species, the criminal species, will probably be among the last ones to go totally extinct because the top 1 percentile will be able to save their skin and hang on. Over the last 50 years 70-80% of all wildlife has been wiped out by human beings. A 1000 species are going extinct every day. That's what we are doing.

Title: Spirituality and Logic
Core Message: Spirituality is the very zenith of logic - there is no contradiction between spirituality and logic.
Excerpt: There is a lot of pseudoscience and superstition being floated in the name of spirituality by people that you are influenced by. And therefore, the common man gets a message that spirituality means some mumbo-jumbo. Spirituality is not this godman business. In fact, a really spiritual man can never contradict science. If you are really logical, you will turn spiritual. You have no option. Spirituality is the natural destiny of logic.

Title: Pay The Price Before It Is Too Late
Core Message: The real thing costs everything that you hold sacred. Pay the price before it is too late.
Excerpt: You think of the right, free, and spiritual life as planned, tasteless, and boring. No, it involves great love, great rejections, great revenges. Everything happens in a much more intense way than in your normal householder's life. You say, “I’m leading a worldly life because I want to have fun or because I’m in love.” But one day you’ll realize what you call love isn’t even 1% of the real thing. Then you’ll knock on the doors of the real thing—and won’t be permitted.

Title: The Gift Of Genuine Guilt
Core Message: When guilt is real and complete, it becomes an agent of change.
Excerpt: It's probably a blessing when we commit blunders that can no longer be hidden or justified because only then are we forced to admit to ourselves that we are operating from the wrong center. When this happens and our act of ignorance harms a loved one, we cannot undo it, but there is something within us that can be undone - that's the opportunity. When guilt is real and complete, it shows you the completeness of your unconsciousness and becomes an agent of change. When it is superficial, it becomes an agent of defense.

Title: Are Death Rituals Important?
Core Message: Rituals matter only at the level of the mind and society. Those who are prepared to go against society can do so, but those who are not yet ready to manage the consequences of rebellion don't need to needlessly rebel.
Excerpt: Death has a certain significance. But rituals, whether at the time of birth or death, mean nothing to Prakriti. And even at the level of the Truth, where there is neither birth nor death, rituals don’t matter. In between these two is the level of the social mind -- this is where rituals seem to matter. Not an absolute significance but if you are heavily influenced by society, going against it has consequences. Those who still can't take blows don't need to get into needless rebellions. There are bigger battles to fight. But those who can, I would never discourage from rising.

Title: Should We Study In Our Native Languages?
Core Message: Education should first raise consciousness of the child. The medium of instruction comes second. There are numerous examples of people who were educated in one language, but their best work was done in other languages.
Excerpt: Language is a wonderful thing, and I too have a special feeling for our native tongues — we respect them and love them. We now have channels in Hindi, Telugu, Tamil, Bengali, Kannada, and more, including the world’s largest Hindi channel. But these might never have come without my English-medium education, because India's educational infrastructure in native languages is still weak. So, the first priority must be quality. Education should first raise consciousness — the medium of instruction comes after that.

Title: Reject All Readymade Answers
Core Message: Independent inquiry is the only way to discover what is truly important in one's life, not readymade answers.
Excerpt: As young people, we mistakenly take tradition to be the truth. Tradition tells you in advance, "This is important.", and you believe it. This has to stop. You must question, inquire, and experiment. Because if you have readymade definitions of what is important, then you will never come to what is truly important. And when you independently inquire, a lot of unimportant nonsense disappears from life and fresh space is revealed. Now, through your own discretion and wisdom, if you decide that these things are indeed important, then so be it.

Title: Is There Such A Thing As Immortality?
Core Message: Immortality is not in the expanse of time, it is in the quality of time.
Excerpt: There is nothing that can continue in time unchallenged, untested, undefeated. The moment anything starts journeying in time, it is bound to be defeated and die. So, how is immortality or eternity possible at all? It is possible only when your association with things in time is deep. Eternity lies in the quality of time, not in the expanse of time. And the depth of association is known by seeing how we usually superficially relate, without attention or inquiry into what they really are. This superficiality is mortality.

Title: Don’t Believe. Choose Facts Over Fluff OR Romantic Mysticism vs. Real Spirituality
Core Message: Strip the Fluff. Question Deeply. Stand with Truth.
Excerpt: Real spirituality is actually a shameless path—not something elevated, admirable, or respectable. In contrast, conventional spirituality or ‘lok dharm’ feels poetic, enchanting, and romantically mystical. But the most familiar statements are often the ones that need your deepest scrutiny. Whenever you're bombarded with lofty, high-sounding language, ask: “What exactly do you mean by that?” Expect answers rooted in bare facts—not in abstractions, idioms, euphemisms, or vague pointers. Facts are ignored when some kinds of sugary idioms are used by the speaker.

Link: Why Are Relationships Getting More Possessive?
Title: Do Men Fear Loss More Than Love?
Core Message: Hormones push us; society shapes us; both are traps.
Excerpt: Excerpt: Most choices in love arise either from the body or from society. Women in our middle-class setup often sacrifice more because they have less to lose; patriarchy never gave them inheritance or freedom, so the stakes are lower. Men guard what they have. And then the body—with its hormones and emotions—pushes both into decisions they think are theirs but are not. Real spirituality begins when one sees these two traps and refuses to yield.

Title: What Does Shraddh Mean?
Core Message: Shraddh means honoring our ancestors by helping all our siblings, helping the planet
Excerpt: Shraddh has become an elaborate ceremony of superstition that is not to be called religious. Shraddh means realizing your true ancestry and working for all your brothers and sisters. Because, if we come from the same parent, can the parent be happy if my siblings are suffering? So if you want to please your parents, help your siblings by liberating yourself from ignorance, help the entire planet.

Title: Settling For Something Lower?
Core Message: You settle for something cheap because you dont respect/love yourself
Excerpt: If you do not respect the highest, then you're not respecting yourself. You're just respecting some little and lowly part of yourself, which is not self-respect at all then. When you have real self-respect, then you give yourself the highest. You won't give yourself some cheap thing. But you can easily settle for anything. That's the issue with the human condition. Please don't do that.

Title: What Happens After Inner Death?
Core Message: Life begins after inner death
Excerpt: When inner death happens, then life begins. But there is nobody who is living the life — there is just life. As long as there is somebody who is living, life is very deathlike. When you think that you are alive, you are actually dead. Now, which one do you want? The alive one, who is alive but as good as dead, or a lively life, which is complete in all aspects but lacks just one thing — the living one.

Title: How To Break Mental Patterns?
Core Message: Involve yourself with something much more important
Excerpt: If you think in terms of what to do with what's going on in the mind, then you are only providing it with more energy, that just continues the cycle. It’s humanly impossible that there will be nothing in the mind. So one needs a higher object to think about. Involve yourself with something so humongous, that you cannot ignore it even for a second. And then all the petty little thoughts will get crowded out.

Title: Who Am I?
Core Message: You are your present action
Excerpt: You are the quality of your present action. You are, right now, attention itself, if you are indeed listening to me.  Unfortunately, this identity won't last. Soon you will be distracted. You'll become somebody else. The discipline lies in holding on to the highest identity possible, that which you know to be the highest, given your limited capacity. That's who you should be. That's the answer to — ‘Who am I?’

Title: Is India Really a Renewable Energy Nation?
Core Message: Numbers mislead; real change is coal reduction.
Excerpt: India is celebrating that 50% of our installed electricity capacity is from non-fossil sources, but installed capacity is only potential, not actual generation. Coal still produces 72% of our electricity. In 2023, India released three billion tons of CO₂, ranking third globally. The real challenge—cutting coal, reducing emissions and protecting ourselves from the climate crisis that is already burning our fields and flooding our homes—remains untouched. Is this a victory or rather a warning?

Title: What Does It Take to Read 'Truth Without Apology'?
Core Message: Spirituality is about the quality of our experience. Even flying fails if blind; even crawling succeeds if awake. The center is everything.
Excerpt: Spirituality is not about obtaining heaven, or pleasing gods, or accumulating virtue. It is about taking care of the quality of your experience, because that is all that is there in life. If the experiencer operates from the wrong center, then even flying won’t help. When you are operating from the right center, even crawling is all right. This is all that Truth Without Apology brings. Each chapter in this book is like a Zen Koan.

Title: Devi Worship: Reverence Without Possession
Excerpt: You are the subject, Puruṣa, and everything you can experience, perceive, speak, imagine, or think is Prakṛti. The only real spiritual question is to determine the right relationship between Puruṣa and Prakṛti. India came up with a beautiful answer: worship Prakṛti with reverence, but do not try to possess or exploit her. The Śakti tradition with the Devi-pūjā is nothing but an answer to this question of right relationship. Durgā, Ambikā, and Kālī — they all represent Prakṛti.

Title: Psychedelic Drugs: Shortcut to Spirituality?
Core Message: Psychedelic drugs cannot replace true guidance; they offer temporary illusion, not the real spiritual awakening or peace (Samadhi).
Excerpt: The mind is eager to go beyond the daily, mundane experiences, and that’s why the seeker goes to a Teacher. But if the Teacher fails in bringing the seeker to the beyond, then this is the option that the Teacher has. So, recommending the use of psychedelic drugs, in fact, just tells of the inability of the Teacher to take the seeker beyond usual consciousness through other means. It’s like you want Samadhi (peace), and instead of that, you are given Nidra (sleep).

Link: The Truth-Centered Perspectives on Indian Culture and Traditions
Title: The Truth-Centered Perspectives on Indian Culture and Traditions
Core Message: Mukti Over Sanskriti: The Gita’s Call to Inner Liberation
Excerpt: Traditions hold meaning only when they point toward Truth—timeless, Sanatan, and therefore sacred. The Bhagavad Gita, in essence, is a struggle of Mukti against sanskriti. Shri Krishna urges Arjun to discard misogyny and cultural superstition, and to focus solely on liberation from inner bondage—Mukti. The true man, devoted to truth, aligns with Sri Krishna, not with culture and traditions, which are man-made constructs. These must either evolve continuously with time or be discarded.

Title: Why Do People Choose Suicide?
Core Message: Suicide carries hope and arrogance. Even in despair, ending life may not solve troubles, and true disappointment can stop the act itself.”
Excerpt: Even in suicide, there lies a lot of arrogance. They feel that suicide would bring their troubles to an end. What if it does not? Now, what would they do? And it is irreversible. They are still carrying a lot of hope. If I do not know what is beyond life, how can I enter that which is beyond life? Surely, I am placing my hopes there. If you are really disappointed, then you would be so disappointed that you can't even commit suicide.

Title: Our Silent Suicides
Core Message: Suicide is a wasted opportunity. So, if we do not reach our potential in our life, it is a suicide.
Excerpt: A suicide is a sad event because it prevents us from realizing our possibility and potential -- there was an opportunity to live, learn, grow, realize, and be liberated -- but it was wasted. But how many of us actually manage to realize our potential even if we live till 80 years? Hardly anybody. So, are we all not guilty of suicide? When it comes to our species, the extent of our aliveness is proportional to the freedom and height of our consciousness. So, ask yourself honestly, “How close am I to the best I could have been?”

Title: Will we stay ordinary, or dare to rise as heroes?
Core Message: Ordinary follows the norm; heroes defy it.
Excerpt: We venerate Bismil, Rajguru, Bhagat Singh, and Azad, yet many were let down by their own compatriots. In every era, most are ruled by their biological compulsions. We all come from the jungle, and it still governs us—filth, alcoholism, womanizing, weakness. Amidst this filth, a miracle must arise. The villains are ordinary; the hero is the one who dares to emerge against the flow, against the norm. The world will not hand us heroes—it is we who must rise and become one.

Title: What Makes Compassion Real?
Core Message: True compassion is beyond ego and self-interest; it is not attachment or kindness to benefit oneself, but care free of all motives.
Excerpt: When a mother exhibits a certain behavior towards her child, we often call it love or even compassion. But if I am good to someone who is related to me through self-interest, that is not compassion. Compassion is a relationship free of self-interest. Real compassion is when you are not operating from the center of the ego at all; it is not about the ego wearing a pleasant face.

Title: Rebellion Doesn’t Need Results?
Core Message: Right action is its own reward. Only a fearless, free mind can act or rebel truly—without being bound by outcomes, fear, or self-centered calculations.
Excerpt: Do what is right. And forget all about the result. The right action is its own reward. There is no need to split the action from the result. But such clarity and confidence in action can come only when the mind is free—free from fear and calculations. There can be no rebellion in an environment of carefulness. Real rebellion needs a mind that doesn’t depend on outcomes or securities.

Title: Gandhi: An Earthly Journey, Not a Divine Destination
Core Message: What was possible for Gandhi is possible for all.
Excerpt: Gandhi did not descend from the sky; he rose from the earth. He undertook a laborious and long journey from man to Mahatma. And he rightly said that his life is his message -- what was possible for him is possible for all. When someone devotedly moves forward, challenging their past, tendencies, and limitations, their presence infuses a unique consciousness into the entire world.

Title: Let Closeness Not Become A Cage
Core Message: A good marriage should have boundaries
Excerpt: We are limited beings and limitation means boundaries. Any successful marriage will have boundaries.  Spend quality time with each other and then leave each other free, both physically and psychologically. Don't demand or expect that you would be present in the other's mind all the time. Yes, I'm available, but I'm not omnipresent. You cannot be at the other all the time. Good fences make good neighbors.

Title: Living in Security And Freedom
Core Message: True security is an inner inviolable space.
Excerpt: At the level of the body, this world will have an influence on you and there is no need to even contest that. Let it happen because it is going to happen anyway. But inwardly, let there be a place so sacred that nobody is allowed to enter, not even you. And when that is there, you can freely participate in the world because you'll no longer be afraid. You'll say, "Come what may, I'm secure within." Then, you will in deep security and we all know how pleasing security is.

Link: Climate Action: Why Governments Keep Resisting
Title: If leaders fail, who is truly responsible?
Core Message: Real change never begins in power; it begins in people.
Excerpt: We all want policy reform, climate action, honest leaders. But who will bring that change? The very ministers we blame are the ones we elect. Real change never begins in parliaments — it begins in people. Even collective revolutions are born from awakened individuals. If we remain asleep, no leader can save us. Policies won’t change until people do. Stop waiting for a savior — become awake enough that power itself begins to listen.

Link: Do not be Reluctant to Embrace Pain
Title: Do not be Reluctant to Embrace Pain
Core Message: Choose Joy, Accept Suffering; Joy Demands More than Happiness.
Excerpt:
To be born is to be born into choice. If you choose joy, be willing to embrace pain, for joy is neither easy nor cheap. The ambition of the Sages and wise was to eliminate that which remains sad and therefore seeks happiness. True joy arises when happiness is no longer needed. If you keep chasing shallow happiness, joy will slip away. Life’s purpose is not happiness, but the dissolution of sadness at its root and that is liberation. Updated as per the feedback:
Life’s purpose is not the pursuit of happiness, but the dissolution of sadness at its root—that is liberation. The wise and the Sages sought to eliminate the inner seed that remains sorrowful and thus craves happiness. True joy arises only when happiness is no longer necessary and emerges from a deep understanding of your pain. If you continue to chase superficial happiness, joy will evade you; and if you choose joy, do not be reluctant to embrace pain.

Title: Self-Worth Is a Lie You've Been Sold
Core Message: To have any real self-worth, you must have clarity about the self.
Excerpt: The self has no free existence of its own -- it is nothing but associations with the objects around it, absorbing even its sense of worth from the environment. It believes that without depending on the world, it is a hollow, incomplete nobody. So, to hide this absence of self-worth, we keep running after all kinds of things but the promise of fulfillment is never kept and we are deceived. Therefore, to have any self-worth, you must have clarity about the self. And all wisdom literature through the centuries exists for this reason -- to clear away the false notions of the self.

Title: Krishna Is The Heart of Arjun
Core Message: Arjun and Krishna are both in us, Arjun is the deluded mind and Krishna is the heart
Excerpt: Arjun and Krishna are both within us. Arjun is the lost, deluded mind. And just by sheer grace, he enters into a dialog with an immensity that is beyond him. Otherwise really, Krishna is not standing in front of Arjun, Krishna is the heart of the Arjun, the very “Aatman”. And without Krishna being in Arjun, Arjun would not have been able to listen to the Krishna standing in front of Arjun.

Title: Earned The Right To Celebrate Diwali?
Core Message: One needs to live the right life the entire year to celebrate Diwali
Excerpt: You need to earn the right to even utter ‘Ram.’ If, for 364 days, you have really lived up to Ram, only then, must you celebrate the festival of Ramness.” For 364 days your life had nothing to do with Ram and on the 365th day, you join the noisy bandwagon. If Ram were there in a bodily shape, he would say, “You stand in firm opposition to me.” So observe this day as a day of repentance.

Title: Rumi's Innocent Surrender
Excerpt: To say, “I am such a devotee that I will reach freedom through my efforts. And I will not stop till I am liberated”, might sound like a statement of commitment, devotion, and deep mystical thirst; but it is actually just arrogance. Rumi has done the fullest that the human mind can do, and has left no stone unturned. And after doing what he could do, he has simply raised his hands and surrendered. This is the utmost that this mortal form can do.

Title: Living Evidence Of The Aatman
Core Message: The Aatman cannot be thought of but its evidence is there in intense, honest, and rightful living.
Excerpt: The Aatman, or the Self, is the only Truth that there is. And it is not in us; we are in it. This fundamental point must be deeply understood. One cannot touch or think of the Aatman. If you think and talk, you will only have concepts about the Aatman, or Truth, or God. But in intense, honest, daily living, there is evidence of the Aatman. And that evidence is not a mental object or an idea — in fact, it comes as a shock. The Aatman cannot belong to you in any way, but you can belong to the Aatman — this is called surrender, and it is the only rightful way of living.

Title: Why Don’t We Accept Brilliance?
Core Message: We think that brilliance is also trash
Excerpt: What surrounds you is 99.99% trash. And if, by glorious chance, there is 0.01% greatness, brilliance, selfless compassion, you will never accept it because you are used to the usual 99.99%. You will think even this one is of the same type. Out of 10,000 people you meet, 9,999 are corrupt. The remaining one, exactly because he’s very rare, would not be appreciated. He would be considered similar to the 9,999.

Title: Why Should I Trust The Gita?
Core Message: Anything that does not exclusively talk of the self is to be kept away. That is not Vedanta at all.
Excerpt: Joy is not a problem. Suffering is a problem. So I start from there. I am the sufferer. And if this "I" is the problem, the sufferer, then firstly, the "I" itself has to be approached. And when I find that my efforts are getting saturated, I'll go to something that talks exclusively of the "I". Therefore, if you come across something that is dealing in stories, beliefs, and deviating from the self, you must know that it is not Vedanta at all. This is how you detect that you are reading a wrong kind of interpretation of the scriptures.
